g.text: Table 2. Asubset of vulnerability indices applied at a national scale for SIDs that incorporate natural disasters, climate variability or climate change.

impacts of climate change and climate-
To provide a way to identify risk

2. Stock of available funds for recovery

vulnerability of the SIDs or to identify the

To reflect the extent to which the natural
environment of a country is prone to

Fig 2. Vulnerability rank of some Caribbean countries.
EcVI is the economic vulnerability index [
]. RMI is the Risk Management Index [
] and CCVI is the Climate Change
]. A value of 1/114 indicates the highest vulnerability of the 114 countries in the study.
